718577f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718577f-a.text:
Centre Street, west side, from Leonard to Franklin
Street's, showing the entrance to the original 'Tombs''.
This was erected in 1840, and replaced the Colonial
''Bridewell'' of Revolutionary War fame that stood on the
Commons (City Hell Park) from 1735 to 1838.
About 1890
American Studio
87 Nassau Street
Reproduction Rights Unknown
718577f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718578f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718578f-a.text:
Centre Street, west side, from Leonard to Franklin
Street's, showing the Tombs, erected 1840. This
structure, occupying the entire block west to Lafay-
ette Street, replaced the Bridewell of City Hall Park.
The latter stood from 1735 to 1838.
About 1890
Mildenburg, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection
NO REPRODUCTIONS
718578f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718580f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718580f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718576f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718576f-a.text:
Centre Street, west side, north from and including Leonard Street.
Buildings shown are (left to right). The Tombs, the Criminal Court Build-
ing and the Board of Health Building.
About 1927.
New York Egison Co.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718576f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

720886f-a.title: Manhattan: Leonard Street - Centre Street
720886f-a.text:
Leonard Street, west from and includihg Centre Street, showing (right),
The Tombs Prison extending to Lafayette Street. Also shown (left), is the
New York Life Insurance Co. Building on the west side of Lafayette Street, be-
tween Leonard Street and Catherine Lane,
October 22, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
720886f-a.folder: Leonard Street & Centre Street, Manhattan, NY

718572f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718572f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718569f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718569f-a.text:
Centre Street, west side, south from Leonard to Worth Streets,
showing the easterly side of the new Board of Health Bldg. on Foley
Square. To the richt and left of same appears the Tombs and the
Woolworth Bldg. respectively. The cleared area in the foreground is
part of the new site of the new Criminal Courts (and prison) Bldg.
June 12, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
718569f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718575f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718575f-a.text:
Centre Street, north from and across Leonard Street, showing on
opposite sides of this thoroughfare the fombs and the old Criminal
Courts Bldg. and their new sites. The latter incorporates two complete
blocks east of Centre to Baxter Streets and north from Leonard,
acroas Franklin to White Streets. It will be built at a cost of
18,500,000. of which the P.4.A. will contribute '8,325,00O. An
article on same appears on page 21 of the New York Times of
Aug. 1, 1938.
June 12, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTINS.
718575f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718583f-b.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718583f-b.text:
Centre Street,west side, from Leonard, across Franklin to
Vhite Streets, showing at that location the Tombs and te Criminal
Couurts Bldg., joined by the ''Bridge of Sighs''. Tese are to be re-
placed by modern structures which will be erected in the near future
on the cleared lands seen in the foreground. An article on same
apoears in the Nev York Times of Aucust 1, 1D38 on page 21. The
photocraphers vantae point is on Baxter Street, viewing westward
from Leonard St (in No. 1), between Leonard and Franklin Streets.
(in No. 2) and Bavard Street (in No. 3).
The new Criminal Courts Pldg. and city prison will cost
'18,500,O00. of which the P.W.A. will supply ~8,325,O00 against
the city share of ~10,175,000. It will have four winggs; the norther-
1y unit, containing the 16 story prison building will be separated
from the courts by an open courtyard. A 17 story structure, provid-
ing for Magistrate, Special and General sessions and Supreme Courts
with their staffs, will also house 28 court rooms, two grand jury
rooms and four floors of offices for the District Attorney and have
its main entrance on Center Street.
Jue 12, 1938.
Views 1,2 and 3.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718583f-b.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

720885f-b.title: Manhattan: Leonard Street - Centre Street
720885f-b.text:
Leonard Street, east from Centre, to Baxter Streets, showing
the southerly side of the new Criminal Courts Bldg. site being
cleared. To the right appears a side of the New York State Bldg.
and the spire of the Transfigu:ation Roman Catholic Church in
Chinatown.
April 23, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
A northeastward view of the same area at a slightly later date
and showing completed demolition. Buildings seen in the background
are on the north side of Bayard Street, east from Baxter Street
left). Between the Columbus Park trees and over an outdoor stand
in same appears a turretted structure that is P.S. No. 23 and which
is located at the N.E. corner of Bavard and Mulberry Streets.
June 12, 1938.
720885f-b.folder: Leonard Street & Centre Street, Manhattan, NY

718571f-b.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718571f-b.text:
Centre Street, east side, north from Leonard Street
(foreground of No. 1 and the vantage point of No. 2), showing
the new Criminal Courts and Prison Builaing under construction.
This will ocoupy a plot bounded by Centre, Leonar, Baxter
and White (buildings shown upon same) Streets and will have four
wings. It will be a 17 story structure containing 2P court rooms
and have its main entrance on Jentre Street. The prison wing will
be 16 stories and will house 1,O90 inates. This will be the
northerly wing and will be separated from the courts by an open
court yard.
The structure partiaily seen at the rimht of View No. 1 is
the Hew York SEate Builoing. Note in the left background the dome
atop the Central Building of the Police Departnent.
February 12, 1939
Views: 1-2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIOIIS
718571f-b.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718568f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718568f-a.text:
(1) Centre Street, west side, north from Worth Street. This view
shows the tombs.
February 24, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from a different angle, showing a further view north
on Centre Street. Also shown is Leonard Street, west from Centre,
to and including Lafayette Streets. Included also is Lafayette
Street, west side, north from but not including Leonard, to but not
including Franklin Streets. In the foreground is shown a clear-
ance for the Department of Health Building.
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718568f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718568f-b.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street

February 24, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718568f-b.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718570f-c.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718570f-c.text:
Centre Street, east side, north from Leonard Street, showing
two blocks of buildings under demolition for the new Criminal Courts
Bldg. and prison. These are the Leonard to Franklin and Franklin
to White Streets blocks, east from Centre to Baxter Streets.
View No. 2 of this set shows Franklin to hite Streets unit.
No. 3 is from Leonard Street (as in View No. 1) at a slightly
later date and showing a more advanced stage of destruction. The
1O and 12 story loft buildings bear No. 124-28-32 White Street.,
heing on the north side of same, between Centre and Baxter Streets
and are not to fall.
tarch 11, 1938
Views 1 and 2
View 3:April 23, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718570f-c.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718573f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718573f-a.text:
Centre Street, east side, north from Leonard Street, showing the
west side of a two block unit that will be cleared to provide a new site
for a new Criminal Courts Building and Prison. This will include that
area, east from Centre to Baxter Streets and north from Leonard, across
Franklin to White Streets. No. 2 of this set is from a vantage point
slightly northward.
November 2, 1937.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718573f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718573f-b.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

718574f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Leonard Street
718574f-a.text:
Centre \& Lafayette Street's, north across Leonard
Street, showing in the foreground the old Tombs prison.
This is bounded by the three aforementioned thorough-
fares, with Franklin Street on it's far side. Centre
Street is at the right; Lafayette Street is on the left.
The quadrangular structure in the block above will be
removed for the Criminal Courts Bldg. This is the Frank-
lin to White Street's block.
Prior to 1890
American Studio, photo
87 Nassau Street, N.Y.C.
REPRODUCTION RICBTE UNENOwN
718574f-a.folder: Centre Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY
